definition: to face off against one's adversary (military, sports etc)
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
rampart/base (in baseball)/to build with stones, bricks etc

sentences.english: Ronaldo camped on the left-wing to battle with Ferreira.
sentences.chinese: 罗纳尔多打左边锋，对垒费雷拉。

sentences.english: The world is in a situation akin to sitting at the fault line between two tectonic plates straining against each other.
sentences.chinese: 当今世界处于一种两阵对垒极度向对方施压的局面。

sentences.english: Pragmatists and ideologues seem to be pitching rival camps in the capital.
sentences.chinese: 实用派和理论派似乎在首都扎营对垒了。

sentences.english: Who would win in a street fight between Megatron and Optimus Prime?
sentences.chinese: 街战对垒中，老威和擎天柱谁赢了？

definition: to cross swords/to have a confrontation (with sb)
to meet/to run into (sb)/to get together (with sb)
lit. to meet face to face on a narrow path (idiom)/fig. enemies or rivals meet face to face
to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
poised for battle/to square up for a fight
to be utterly defeated/to be routed
to score a victory/to prevail over one's opponents
